snippet: The Annenberg Foundation bought more than $500,000 in sacred artifacts at a Paris auction to restore them to the Hopi Indians in Arizona.
abstract: Annenberg Foundation bought more than $500,000 in stolen artifacts at a Paris auction to restore them to the Hopi Indians in Arizona; to prevent prices from rising, foundation kept its plan secret, in part to protect tribe from potential disappointment; tribe, which had tried unsuccessfully to block sale in French court, believes items are not simply religious, but living entities with divine spirits.
lead_paragraph: The Annenberg Foundation bought more than $500,000 in sacred artifacts at a Paris auction to restore them to the Hopi Indians in Arizona.

headline.main: Secret Bids Guide Hopi Indians’ Spirits Home
headline.print_headline: Secret Bids Guide Hopi Indians’ Spirits Home
